p: Dengue virus (DENV) is a positive-stranded encapsulated RNA virus of family Flaviviridae having four serotypes referred to as DEN-1, DEN-2, DEN-3, and DEN-4.[ 1] It is composed of three structural protein genes, which encodes the nucleocapsid or core (C) protein, a membrane-associated (M) protein, an enveloped (E) glycoprotein and seven nonstructural (NS) proteins. They are transmitted chiefly by the Aedes Aegypti mosquito and also by Aedes albopictus.[ 2] Aedes Aegypti also transmits Chikungunya, yellow fever, and Zika infections.[ 1]
